heroIntro: Discover your Mediterranean escape in this beautifully positioned 2-bedroom villa in Calpe, one of Costa Blanca's most sought-after holiday destinations. Priced at €470,000, this property offers exceptional value at Calpe's average market rate, making it an intelligent investment for those seeking a sunshine retreat without premium pricing. Whether you're dreaming of lazy summers by the beach, authentic Spanish village life, or a lucrative second home investment, this Ortenbach villa delivers on all fronts. Calpe's dramatic Peñón d'Ifach backdrop, world-class beaches, and thriving international community create the perfect setting for year-round relaxation or holiday lettings. With 45 professional images showcasing every detail, you'll see exactly why holiday home buyers and investors are choosing this property as their Costa Blanca gateway.
areaSection: Calpe sits on Costa Blanca's northern coast, where rugged limestone cliffs meet crystalline Mediterranean waters. The iconic Peñón d'Ifach rock formation dominates the skyline, creating one of Spain's most recognizable natural landmarks. Located between the prettier villages of Jávea and Altea, Calpe enjoys 320 days of annual sunshine and average winter temperatures of 14°C—perfect for escaping colder northern climates. The town's unique geography creates protected coves and Blue Flag beaches while maintaining authentic Spanish character despite its international appeal. Calpe's elevation on terraced hillsides provides stunning open views across the sea, and the compact town size means beaches, restaurants, and amenities are all within minutes. The area's transformation from fishing village to upscale destination has been carefully managed, preserving Mediterranean charm while adding modern conveniences.
lifestyleSection: Life in Calpe revolves around beach culture, outdoor dining, and genuine international community. Wake to Mediterranean breezes, spend mornings at Arenal-Bol's Blue Flag beach or exploring hidden coves at Cantal Roig. The weekly market buzzes with fresh local produce—visit Tuesday or Wednesday mornings at the municipal market. British and German expats form the backbone of the community, so English is widely spoken in tourist areas, restaurants, and local businesses, making integration effortless. Afternoons drift into tapas at beachfront chiringuitos, evening paseos (walks) through the charming old town, and dinner at one of Calpe's excellent seafood restaurants. For active holidays, Club de Golf Ifach is just 5 minutes away, while hiking the Peñón offers spectacular coastal views. Healthcare is excellent with English-speaking doctors readily available, and grocery shopping is convenient with Mercadona, Consum, and Lidl all within easy reach.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Calpe's thoughtfully developed infrastructure ensures holiday living is genuinely convenient. Modern supermarkets sit alongside traditional markets, international schools provide British curriculum options, and healthcare matches northern European standards. Public transport connections improve monthly, with a tram system arriving soon. The expatriate-friendly environment means banking, legal services, and commercial support operate in English.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Calpe and surrounding areas exceeds expectations for a coastal town. Centro de Salud Calp provides primary care with Spanish-speaking and English-speaking medical professionals. Hospital de Dénia, located 30 minutes away, offers comprehensive modern facilities with emergency services, specialist departments, and English-speaking staff accustomed to international patients. Private clinics throughout the area cater to expatriate needs, with many doctors trained abroad and fluent in English. Prescription medications are affordable and readily available. Comprehensive Spanish healthcare insurance is accessible to residents and property owners. Medical tourism in the region is well-established, meaning infrastructure and staff expertise in treating international patients is sophisticated.

education.text: International education options serve expatriate families throughout Costa Blanca. Lady Elizabeth School in nearby Cumbre del Sol (10 minutes) offers British curriculum education from kindergarten through secondary school. Laude Newton College provides English-medium instruction with IB programs and modern facilities (35 minutes away). Both schools serve the established expat community and maintain high academic standards. Spanish public schools are also excellent and increasingly offer bilingual programs. Tuition costs prove significantly lower than UK independent schools, making quality education affordable.

shopping.text: Daily shopping combines European supermarket convenience with authentic Spanish market culture. Mercadona, Consum, and Lidl provide familiar shopping experiences with international products available. The weekly street market (Tuesday and Wednesday mornings) offers fresh produce, seafood, and local specialties at outstanding value. Mas y Mas supermarket stocks organic and premium products. El Corte Inglés department store in nearby Benidorm (20 minutes) provides upscale shopping for fashion and homewares. Online shopping delivers throughout Spain, making remote purchasing convenient.

transport.text: Getting around Costa Blanca is straightforward with multiple transportation options. Alicante-Elche Airport, 75 minutes away, connects to major European cities daily. Local bus services link Calpe to Benidorm, Valencia, and surrounding coastal towns. Exciting tram infrastructure currently under development will soon connect Benidorm-Finestrat-Calpe-Altea, dramatically improving regional connectivity. Driving provides independence—the N-332 coastal road connects to major routes, and parking is generally available. Car rentals are affordable for those preferring not to drive personally. The compact town size means most amenities are walkable or a short drive away.
